A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This is the first Star Wars film I actually feel disappointed in. So I have waited for 20 years to see Luke Skywalker on screen again and Luke Skywalker was one of my many childhood heroes growing up. And Disney/Lucasfilm has done something unwise to him in order for the new generation to shine. Namely character assassination.

And the boring and totally unnecessary Canto Bight story was just a way for Disney to sell more plush Fathier toys and merchandise. I learnt nothing significantly new about the Force and cannot believe the Luke that used love and compassion to help his father to redeem himself will go on & do something so out of character to his own nephew.

Disney has ruined the character of Luke Skywalker and my childhood hero deserved better than this character assassination. The two stars above are for Mark Hamill's amazing & breadth-taking performance and for Carrie Fisher's brilliant turn as our eternal Princess of Alderaan.

This will not be a film I will rewatch. Luke deserved better.
